intro: Medinilla aurantiiflora, commonly known as the golden flame medinilla, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of striking orange-red flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Medinilla aurantiiflora is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant and long-lasting blooms.
